image.altText: Man leaning on balcony railing with coffee cup, looking out to sea, small wallaby marsupial behind him, coastal background

props.synopsis: Ron Taylor lives most of the year wandering around his island home in solitude, living off-grid away from the pressures of the rat race. It's a "great lifestyle".

title.children: Ron could be a modern-day Gilligan living on his isolated island. But he has no desire to be rescued

image.altText: An artist's impression of a housing project at Seaton in Adelaide's west.

props.synopsis: Housing measures in South Australia's upcoming budget include another relaxation of stamp duty, and funds for more than 1,900 homes across suburban Adelaide — but hundreds of tenants will be forced to move when properties are demolished.

title.children: Hundreds of new SA homes get big budget boost, as stamp duty abolished for first-time buyers of new homes

image.altText: A white-haired woman in blue cardigan holds a tea-cup in both hands.

props.synopsis: Dee O'Loughlin says she considered calling a taxi when she fell ill to avoid paying for an ambulance call-out fee — and contemplates strategies like skipping meals to manage the rising cost of living.

title.children: 'Your heart plummets': SA pensioners hesitant to call ambulances over fee fears

image.altText: Packets of Tim Tam biscuits on a shelf, with a price tag saying $11.70

props.synopsis: The cost of living has increased more sharply in regional areas than in the cities, with some outback residents paying double for essential goods like food and fuel. Now the federal government is coming up with a plan to try to level the playing field, but will it work?

title.children: Is this Australia's most expensive town? Tim Tams cost $11.70 a packet or more than $1 each

image.altText: Matildas players pose for a team photo before a game against China.

props.synopsis: Cortnee Vine is among four debutants in Australia's women's football team heading to Paris without seven-time Olympic goalscorer Sam Kerr.

title.children: Matildas name Olympic team with no Sam Kerr, four debutants, 'trailblazers and record breakers'

image.altText: A woman in military uniform looks through a pair of binoculars on the deck of a ship.

props.synopsis: Foreign citizens living permanently in Australia will soon be able to serve in Australia's armed forces, as part of an effort to boost sluggish recruitment.

title.children: Foreign citizens with permanent residency to be allowed to join the Australian Defence Force

image.altText: A smiling young man with short, dark hair sits with his back to a bushy valley.

props.synopsis: Kye Schaefer, 21, died early last month in Coffs Harbour. A 36-year-old man has been charged with murder and is expected to face court this week.

title.children: Murder charge laid after young surfer found stabbed in beachside car park

image.altText: Free range chickens at a farm in western Victoria.

props.synopsis: Farm Pride Foods announces the viral strain detected at its Lethbridge aviary site is "the same strain found on an egg farm at Meredith" around 10 days ago.

title.children: Third Victorian poultry farm declares bird flu outbreak

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: A forensic scientist says the DNA of two people — Toyah Cordingley and an unknown person — was found on the young woman's fingernail clippings.

title.children: DNA of 'unknown' person found under murdered woman's fingernails, court hears

image.altText: Arthur Eaton main pic - cropped

props.synopsis: The Victorian Department of Education faces several lawsuits from survivors who were sexually abused by a teacher the department knowingly moved to other schools after fielding complaints of abuse.

title.children: Serial predator Arthur Eaton 'fooled' everyone with a guide dog puppy and almost became teacher of the year

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a microphone in Congress while a red-haired boy makes a funny face behind him.

props.synopsis: A mischievous six-year-old has gone viral for upstaging his congressman dad in the US House of Representatives.

title.children: US politician's son goes viral for making funny faces at camera as dad delivers speech

image.altText: A man presses his hands together in prayer

props.synopsis: India's election has been a Herculean exercise involving 15 million polling officials and security personnel, 1 million polling stations, more than 8,000 candidates and 744 political parties. Here's what to expect next.

title.children: A 45-hour meditation, coconut water and silence: How India's PM spent the final days of the election

image.altText: Four aboriginal men walk in nature.

props.synopsis: This year, I have spent several months with about a dozen former prisoners at a halfway house in Sydney called Rainbow Lodge. It was a sobering experience, and I'm now thoroughly disabused of my naivety.

title.children: Australia can fix its broken prison system like Norway did. But first, we must face up to the facts

image.altText: A woman and her dog in a tractor

props.synopsis: When farmer Melissa Smyth's not out on her property on the South Australian-Victorian border, she can be found painting or creating mosaics in her shed. Her new-found passion for art was sparked by what's known as the Pinnaroo Project.

title.children: This farming town has found a way to reduce depression and improve wellbeing in the bush

image.altText: Kim looks longingly into the sky from his farm. On the left is another picture of water sloshing around.

props.synopsis: For decades multinational companies like Coca-Cola have been taking water out of the ground for free and bottling it up to sell. A small Perth community is a microcosm of the debate about whether that should continue.

title.children: 'Taking water away': As these Australians battle drought, multinationals have been doing as they please

image.altText: Bill Shorten mid-sentence wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Frontbencher Bill Shorten says he has nothing to do with negotiating the contracts of departmental speechwriters, denying any link to an employee's $600,000 contract to provide speeches across his portfolios.

title.children: 'If you're trying to link me, good luck': Shorten denies any involvement in speechwriter's $300k payday

image.altText: Ali Syed walks down a busy street

props.synopsis: From higher education to fast food, Legal Aid says wage theft is "everywhere" in Australia.

title.children: Wage theft is 'part of Australia's work culture', legal groups say. Now workers are fighting back

image.altText: Light brown French bulldog puppy lying on bright yellow floor.

props.synopsis: Australia has one of the highest pet ownership rates in the world. But are we being the best pet parents possible? Or do we need to rethink how we breed, buy and care for our animals?

title.children: Designer pets are all the rage, but they carry a 'sinister legacy'

image.altText: Interior of an aircraft looking down aisle.

props.synopsis: A quadriplegic teenager was unable to disembark a Virgin flight safely after the airline's own wheelchairs would not fit down the aisle of the plane, his mum says.

title.children: 'It's ridiculous': Quadriplegic teen stuck on flight because Virgin's own wheelchairs 'don't fit' plane aisle

image.altText: Man in suit sitting in Parliament house.

props.synopsis: NDIS Minister Bill Shorten has been pressed in Question Time over revelations from the NDIS integrity chief that unscrupulous providers or participants used funds on items such as drugs, holidays or new cars. Follow live.

title.children: Shorten grilled on claims NDIS money spent on holidays and drugs through dodgy providers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coalition doesn't want Greens MPs on new defence committee
Could Australia reopen Ukraine embassy sometime soon?
NZ Foreign Minister calls Giles over plans to change contentious ministerial directive

image.altText: De Minaur kid

props.synopsis: The unlikely bond between Australia's rising tennis star and a French kid in the crowd made global headlines — and Alex de Minaur wants his young mascot courtside for the rest of his run.

title.children: With his French super fan by his side, Alex de Minaur is winning hearts and minds in Paris

image.altText: A man stands in front of red and green indicator boards.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has lost some ground after heavy falls in oil and iron ore prices and a mixed performance on Wall Street. Follow live.

title.children: ASX loses ground as oil and iron ore prices slump

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rio Tinto to trial using microwaves and food waste to make green steel
P&O Cruises Australia to disappear as a brand

image.altText: A woman vacuuming the floors while a man sits on a couch and uses a laptop. The living room has plants and prints on the wall.

props.synopsis: Weaponised incompetence in relationships can keep women "locked into" traditional roles, experts say.

title.children: Explaining weaponised incompetence and how it 'keeps women busy' at home

image.altText: A man named John Todd handballs an Australian rules football

props.synopsis: John Todd, one of the most influential figures in WA football history, dies at the age of 86.

title.children: WA football great and former West Coast Eagles coach John Todd dies aged 86

image.altText: Frost covers a rural landscape.

props.synopsis: Queensland's south-east has shivered through its coldest temperatures this year, including some areas that dropped below zero overnight.

title.children: Temperatures drop below freezing in parts of Queensland as cold snap arrives

image.altText: Child drawing with crayons

props.synopsis: Almost three quarters of a billion dollars will be sunk into early childhood learning in South Australia as the state moves to implement the recommendations of the recent royal commission, including the rollout of universal preschool for three-year-olds.

title.children: Major funding pledge for preschool in SA following Gillard royal commission

image.altText: Brett Allford wearing a black hat and black sunglasses

props.synopsis: A former South Australian cricket and football umpire has been jailed for sending Uber Eats and make-up to overseas girls in exchange for sexual photos – with his youngest victim being 11-years-old.

title.children: Former SA sporting umpire jailed for sending gifts to girls in exchange for sexual images

image.altText: Two men talk to each other on a dusty unused block

props.synopsis: Residents of one of Western Australia's most disadvantaged towns say community interests have been sidelined amid infighting.

title.children: Outback shire in crisis over sacked CEO as residents demand end to 'childish' infighting

image.altText: A close-up of Hunter Biden's face. He is wearing a suit, tie and American flag pin.

props.synopsis: Just days after a New York jury convicted Donald Trump in his criminal trial, Joe Biden's son is going on trial in a court in Delaware. Here's the case against him, explained.

title.children: As the president's son goes on trial, Biden family drama is likely to be aired in court

image.altText: A man in a suit stands behind the union jack which reads Britain needs reform

props.synopsis: Pro-Brexit campaigner and politician Nigel Farage steps back into front-line politics, announcing he will lead the right-wing Reform Party as a candidate in the upcoming British general election.

title.children: Brexiter Nigel Farage returns to politics as Reform UK leader, challenges Prime Minister Rishi Sunak

image.altText: Emergency workers dressed in hi-vis yellow attend to an exploded house

props.synopsis: An investigation into the house explosion in Sydney's west on Saturday is looking at whether a gas leak was to blame, as an expert says leaks can be difficult to detect but can cause major damage.

title.children: A gas leak potentially destroyed a Sydney home and killed a person inside. Here's what to do when you smell gas

image.altText: A woman with dyed purple hair looks distressed. She is wearing a forest green blazer. Behind her, a man in a hoodie.

props.synopsis: With 200-plus films, Sydney Film Festival's line-up can be overwhelming. Our film critics offer nine must-sees.

title.children: Tilda Swinton at her most eccentric, First Nation folk horror and seven more must-sees at Sydney Film Festival

image.altText: Crime tape outside a block of flats.

props.synopsis: The family of a First Nations woman allegedly murdered by her former partner in Darwin is grieving the loss of a future leader, a local Aboriginal corporation says.

title.children: Indigenous woman allegedly killed by ex-partner was a 'highly respected' future leader

image.altText: Protesters hold signs, including one that says "Hostage Deal Now" and others in foreign script.

props.synopsis: Four more hostages kidnapped on October 7 are declared dead by the Israeli military — including three men seen in a Hamas video begging to be released.

title.children: Israel says hostages who appeared in Hamas video are now dead

image.altText: A TV still of Celeste Mountjoy, a young woman, dancing in a wedding dress. She has an ecstatic expression.

props.synopsis: Artist Celeste Mountjoy, aka Filthyratbag, processes her break-up through the power of art on the premiere episode of ABC TV's new arts show, The Art Of…

title.children: Celeste and her ex drew 300-plus portraits of each other. Now, she processes the break-up on TV
